import React, { useState } from "react"; import Button from "react-bootstrap/Button"; import Modal from "react-bootstrap/Modal"; import Form from "react-bootstrap/Form"; import "./Assest/Style.css"; import emailjs from "emailjs-com"; import { useRef } from "react"; function StudentForm() { const [show, setShow] = useState(false); const handleClose = () => setShow(false); const handleShow = () => setShow(true); const form = useRef(); function AdditionalContentExample() { return ( Hey, nice to see you

Aww yeah, you successfully read this important alert message. This example text is going to run a bit longer so that you can see how spacing within an alert works with this kind of content.

Whenever you need to, be sure to use margin utilities to keep things nice and tidy.

); } const sendEmail = (e) => { e.preventDefault(); emailjs .sendForm( "service_uskafun", "template_t450vuo", form.current, "ivKItVln0cZrmho0T" ) .then( (result) => {}, (error) => { console.log("Error", error.text); } ); handleClose(); }; return ( <> Registration Form
); } export default StudentForm;
